item.title: China Shallow Seismic Structure
item.description:
Goal of this project are two folds: 1) understanding the compositional and thermal states of bedrocks in the upper crust of the Contiental China and 2) constructing a reference shallow seismic model for future studies of imaging deeper seismic structure.

Shallow seismic structure beneath the Continental China

item.title: Crustal thickness and Vp/Vs variation beneath continental China revealed by receiver function analysis
Shallow seismic structure beneath China revealed by P wave polarization, Rayleigh wave ellipticity and receiver function
Shallow seismic structure beneath China revealed by P wave polarization, Rayleigh wave ellipticity and receiver function
Assessment of COSMIC radio occultation water vapor profile
Curriculum Vitae

Download my full CV here.

Education

  • 2023: Ph.D in Geophysics (Expected), University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, China
  • 2017: B.S. in Geophysics, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China

Professional Societies & Services

  • Spring, 2019: Student Organizer of “Weekly Graduate Student Seminar of Geophysics, USTC”
  • 2017 – 2017: Assist in coordinating exchange meeting of China Seismological Reference Model work group
  • 2017 – present: Member of the American Geophysical Union (AGU)
  • 2017 – present: Research assistant and database manager for China Seismological Reference Model work group
  • 2016 – present: Contributor of GMT China Community

Awards & Honors

  • 2017: Outstanding undergraduate graduates of Wuhan University.
  • 2017: Outstanding undergraduate thesis of Wuhan University.
